summary: In addition to the properties listed for the dojo._IoArgs type, the following properties are allowed for dojo.xhr* methods.

properties.name: content
properties.summary: Contains properties with string values. These properties will be serialized as name1=value2 and passed in the request.

properties.name: contentType
properties.summary: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" is default. Set to false to prevent a Content-Type header from being sent, or to a string to send a different Content-Type.

properties.name: failOk
properties.summary: false is default. Indicates whether a request should be allowed to fail (and therefore no console error message in the event of a failure)

properties.name: form
properties.summary: DOM node for a form. Used to extract the form values and send to the server.

properties.name: handleAs
properties.summary: Acceptable values are: text (default), json, json-comment-optional, json-comment-filtered, javascript, xml. See dojo/_base/xhr.contentHandlers

properties.name: headers
properties.summary: Additional HTTP headers to send in the request.

properties.name: ioPublish
properties.summary: Set this explicitly to false to prevent publishing of topics related to IO operations. Otherwise, if djConfig.ioPublish is set to true, topics will be published via dojo/topic.publish() for different phases of an IO operation. See dojo/main.__IoPublish for a list of topics that are published.

properties.name: preventCache
properties.summary: Default is false. If true, then a "dojo.preventCache" parameter is sent in the request with a value that changes with each request (timestamp). Useful only with GET-type requests.

properties.name: rawBody
properties.summary: Sets the raw body for an HTTP request. If this is used, then the content property is ignored. This is mostly useful for HTTP methods that have a body to their requests, like PUT or POST. This property can be used instead of postData and putData for dojo/_base/xhr.rawXhrPost and dojo/_base/xhr.rawXhrPut respectively.

properties.name: sync
properties.summary: false is default. Indicates whether the request should be a synchronous (blocking) request.

properties.name: timeout
properties.summary: Milliseconds to wait for the response. If this time passes, the then error callbacks are called.

methods.name: error

parameters.name: response
parameters.summary: The response in the format as defined with handleAs.

methods.summary: This function will be called when the request fails due to a network or server error, the url is invalid, etc. It will also be called if the load or handle callback throws an exception, unless djConfig.debugAtAllCosts is true. This allows deployed applications to continue to run even when a logic error happens in the callback, while making it easier to troubleshoot while in debug mode.

methods.name: handle

parameters.name: loadOrError
parameters.summary: Provides a string that tells you whether this function was called because of success (load) or failure (error).

parameters.name: response
parameters.summary: The response in the format as defined with handleAs.

methods.summary: This function will be called at the end of every request, whether or not an error occurs.

methods.name: load

parameters.name: response
parameters.summary: The response in the format as defined with handleAs.

methods.summary: This function will be called on a successful HTTP response code.
